column4: hi, i have got a problem with my ubuntu installation. i somehow changed something. the kernel isn't able to load modules anymore.
my /var/log/messages says directly after booting
Loaded 23037 symbols from /boot/System.map-2.6.15-26-386
Symbols match kernel version 2.6.15
No module symbols loaded - kernel modules not enabled
i think i did a ldconfig a while before thinbgs went bad. any way to fix it?
that message has nothing to do with ldconfig
that's kernel modules and symbols, a different thing altogether
my guess is that you somehow installed a new kernel but didn't install it's modules.
do lsmod.  does it list anything?
it says you have a module/kernel mismatch, and it won't install any drivers.
try reinstalling the kernel image you are running.
not reconfigure, reinstall
thanks. i don't have the cdrom deb in my /apt/sources.list anymore, can you give me a hint how to add it again?
sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-kernel...........
if it complains, tell us.
ok i reinstalled it. now just reboot?
cool it works again. thankyou very mouch. any idea what might have caused it? nothing to do with ldconfig you said....!?
right.  ldconfig is related to shared libraries, the .so files in /lib, /usr/lib, etc.
this problem is related to kernel symbols.  the modules (in /lib/modules) must be available for the running kernel.
I have no idea.
indeed, strange.
